messages.messageBody:
On Tue, 25 Dec 2001 08:20:03 -0600, Jessi wrote:
>
>I hope that all of you find one large or small thing to smile
>about today...
>
>Jessi

Thanks, Jessi,
I did have a good day and it was even better when the SIL from hell
arrived and it was *her* dog that pooped where he shouldn't have and
not my new puppy! There *are* small things to smile about:-)
Sarah




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Good Morning!
messages.msgSnippet: Well Christmas has arrived here.  My son is driving me nuts in the fact that he wants to open presents now...I am a mean evil person in making him wait until
messages.messageBody:
Well Christmas has arrived here. My son is driving me nuts in the fact
that he wants to open presents now...I am a mean evil person in making him
wait until 10:00 to open presents.

I got a present today...only 4 out of 12 of my foster dogs pooped in their
crate and no one danced it all over the walls of their crate <G> and the
radio station that I like to listen to that does not always reach where I
live, is coming through loud and clear today and playing great seasonal
music...Talk about finding joy in small things hehehehe

The roast is cooked, my cold is allowing me to breath at least a little bit
today out of my nose and I have a home, heat and food for today. I am very
thankful.

I hope that all of you find one large or small thing to smile about today...

Jessi




<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**
Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
~ Roger Lewin ~
<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**<<**
